disasters.title: Cyclones
disasters.summary: Seasonal low-pressure systems from the Bay of Bengal demand fast imaging and ocean wind mapping.

satellites.name: INSAT-3D
satellites.role: Rapid-scan infrared images and sounding for IMD warnings.

satellites.name: INSAT-3DR
satellites.role: Advanced meteorological observation and weather forecasting for cyclone tracking.

satellites.name: Oceansat-3 (EOS-06)
satellites.role: Scatterometer winds pinpoint cyclone intensity at sea.

response: INSAT rapid imaging delivers storm center fixes every 15 minutes.
Oceansat scatterometer vectors help fishermen advisories and landfall prediction.

disasters.title: Floods
disasters.summary: Monsoon-fed rivers and cloudbursts require day-night radar coverage for inundation mapping.

satellites.name: RISAT-2BR1
satellites.role: All-weather Synthetic Aperture Radar cuts through clouds for flood plain updates.

satellites.name: Cartosat-3
satellites.role: Very high-resolution optical shots guide relief logistics and breach monitoring.

response: RISAT provides district-level flood layers for NDMA dashboards.
Cartosat imagery supports bridge safety checks and evacuation routes.

disasters.title: Forest Fires
disasters.summary: Western Ghats and Himalayan forests rely on thermal monitoring and smoke plume tracking.

satellites.name: Scatsat-1
satellites.role: Ocean wind monitoring also supports fire weather pattern analysis.

satellites.name: RISAT-2BR1
satellites.role: Radar imaging for all-weather fire detection and monitoring.

satellites.name: INSAT-3D
satellites.role: Night-time infrared brightens fire pixels for quick response.

response: Thermal anomaly feeds slip into Van Agni alerting system.
Geostationary coverage keeps fire control rooms updated every 15 minutes.

disasters.title: Landslides
disasters.summary: Fragile Himalayan slopes need precise elevation models and rainfall-linked triggers.

satellites.name: Cartosat-2F
satellites.role: Stereo pairs offer 1 m DEMs to detect slope instability.

satellites.name: GSAT-30
satellites.role: Emergency SATCOM backhauls data from remote hill sensors.

response: Cartosat DEM differencing flags slope creep near highways.
GSAT-30 ensures uninterrupted SDRF communication during fiber cuts.

disasters.title: Drought
disasters.summary: Arid belts of Vidarbha and Rayalaseema need soil moisture, vegetation, and groundwater cues.

satellites.name: Resourcesat-2A
satellites.role: Multi-spectral Earth observation for vegetation and soil moisture monitoring.

satellites.name: RISAT-2BR1
satellites.role: SAR-derived soil moisture indices for agriculture advisories.

response: Resourcesat-2A provides vegetation indices for drought assessment.
RISAT moisture maps feed the National Agricultural Drought Assessment System.
